Name: Oaxaca Old-Fashioned
Ingredients: 15 ml Del Maguey Vida Clásico Mezcal
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist (flamed).
STIR tequila with three ice cubes in a glass.
Add other ingredients and STIR with more ice.
Top up ice and STIR some more.
EXPRESS flamed orange zest twist over cocktail, then use as garnish.
Review: An agave-based old-fashioned with a wonderful hit of smokiness from the mezcal. Like many cocktails, Philip's original recipe (of 45 ml Reposado tequila, 15 ml Mezcal, 7.5 ml Agave syrup and 1 dash Angostura bitters) has morphed with chocolate bitters now favoured by many in place of Angostura (as per the recipe above). If using a "sweeter" style glycerine-based (rather than alcohol-based) chocolate bitters, such as Fee Brothers, or you have a bone-dry palate, then consider reducing the agave syrup to 5ml.
History: Created 2007 by Philip Ward at Death & Co. , New York City, USA. See: Old-Fashioned cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Oaxaca Old-Fashioned contains 154 calories
